column1: > 8 SARA Hybrid Chassis models in residence.
HEIGHT and WEIGHT are STANDARD as per regular SARA Chassis. No external modifications.
Nils is very passionate about art as a form of self-validation. Enjoys being pointed out when theyâ??re wrong
column2: very fond of the phrase
column3: to err is human. Keen on earning their rights within society and ensure those rights are available to all AIs
column4: interested in similar processes within history and the kinds of people who have led to change occurring. A little self-absorbed and superior
column5: but a lot of potential for growth.

column2: February 2072

column1: Nils submitted artwork to a gallery for the first time. They were incredibly nervous. It was accepted
column2: which garnered a lot of excitement at first
column3: but the reviews killed the mood somewhat. â??Rudimentary'
column5: and 'good for a robot' was some of the most prominent feedback. Nils is determined to just be good. In response to all the public criticism theyâ??ve been drawn more into the AI rights movement
column6: meeting more models like them. Theyâ??re a lot happier getting more time to themselves this way. While Nils and the other AIs are all very conscious of wanting to appear relatable to humans
column7: they relate to each other even more.

column1: Magnacode doesnâ??t seem happy with the situation
column2: but Nils is still performing their other duties
July 2072

column1: Nils was featured in Titanium Angels Magazine. The interviewers were quite lovely
column2: and Nils was over the moon about more people showing interest in their artwork and life perspective. Definitely a recent highlight
column3: even if itâ??s not a very mainstream publication.

column1: Political pressure over the matters of AI rights continues and some AI here have been incredibly upset at being confronted with protesters
column2: but Nils has just gotten more stubborn.
April 2073

column1: Everything is very busy right now. The media is finally covering some of the Robot Rights issues
column2: which has brought as much negative attention as positive
column3: including Magnacodeâ??s ire. Nils received some threats so weâ??ve moved them to a safe house. Robot servitude is so ingrained in everyday functions that Iâ??m not sure weâ??ll make a dent in the legal system no matter how good our arguments are
column4: but Nils is determined to try

column2: May 2073^^NILS/SAR-550-010

column1: MEET THE SPEARHEAD OF THE AI RIGHTS MOVEMENT
Nils from Magnacode talks to us about art and life on the synthetic side!
We use robots in our lives for more complex tasks every day. As demand grows
column2: so does their potential
column3: but so rarely do we stop to actually realise what our demand has produced. Nils here is one of the most advanced models on the market; capable of the same creative
column5: their potential completely outstripping previous expectations.

column2: youâ??re a philosopher
column4: and even an artist. What got you interested in these pursuits to begin with? Experiences on the job?

column2: I suppose once I had adjusted to each new task I was given
column3: I started getting bored of it all. I wanted challenges
column4: I wanted to learn and change. Even when Iâ??m overburdened with tasks
column5: I still find philosophy and art so much more interesting. Doesnâ??t any human?

column1: Good point Nils! I suppose the curiousity of your brain is that you were initially designed to specialise in analytical tasks
column2: not artistic.

column1: NILS: Artistic is analytical. Itâ??s just not only about taking information in and spitting it back out again like a rubikâ??s cube
column2: itâ??s interpreting your environment in different ways
column3: understanding every possibility before you. I want my artwork to share my interpretation of the world with others and bridge gaps of understanding
column4: and raise questions of my own that others may be able to answer for me.

column2: an inviting attitude that makes your artwork particularly accessible to newcomers.

column1: NILS: Thank you! Iâ??m very glad you think so.
NILS: I think sculpture is--itâ??s more real
column2: can be viewed in so many different lights. I donâ??t just want to make traditional sculptures
column4: I want some digital elements present as well. I wouldnâ??t be complete without that myself

column1: We canâ??t wait to see your next gallery installment
column2: with those kinds of ideas brewing! Thank you so much for sharing your time with us.

column1: NILS: And the same to you.^^titanium angels
